discussion.content: C. Punchdown tool
The wording is so wrong. A jack needs a punch down tool. A crystal needs a crimper

Selected Answer: C
Punchdown tool !!! Because he wants to connect a cable from the patchfield to the jack in the wall of a room
Guys this is a matter of connecting the cable to the jack and for that, a crimper is required. Read the question again.

it's a crimper because they are asking what tool you need to use to connect it. you can crimp a jack to connect from a patch panel to the breakout box. a punch-down tool can do the same with a jack but you would need a patch cable after. most straightforward is to crimp both ends and just make your own patch cable.
Breakout Boxes use an RJ45 connection. Patch panels can be punch down or feedthrough; Feedthrough also uses an RJ45 connection. Answer is A.
This question is tricky because just looking at patch panels I see some that need a Crimper and others a Punch down tool =/
Crimping is often used to affix a connector to the end of a cable. Wire crimpers look like a pair of pliers, but join two pieces of metal or other ductile materials
answer is Punch down tool

questions.question_text: A technician needs to run cabling from the patch panel to a new breakout box. Which of the following should the technician use to connect the cable to the jack at both the new location and the patch panel in the network wiring closet?

A workstation's RAM is being upgraded to 24GB. The system has six RAM slots supporting DDR4 dual-channel, with a maximum of 32GB total system memory.
Which of the following configurations will maximize system performance?

choices.B: Two 8GB DDR4 chips and one 8GB DDR4 chips
choices.A: Two 4GB DDR4 chips and one 16GB DDR4 chip

discussion.content: D. Six 4GB DDR4 chips
DDR2 and DDR4 are not compatible/interchangible.

Selected Answer: D
DDR2 is no option, ans use the dual-channel-Feature

Selected Answer: D
DDR2 is not compatible with DDR4

Selected Answer: D
DDR2 and DDR4 are not compatible.
'D' is the answer
Correct answer is D. Please update.
D. Six 4GB DDR4 chips
Whats the answer here not B?

comments.content: Because 6 4 DDR4 RAMs can make 3 dual channels. meanwhile "B" only makes 2 1 dual channel.

discussion.content: the answer is absolutely D.if the motherboard had ddr4 in it originally that means that motherboard is built for ddr4 only
I agree with you

questions.question_text: Which of the following cloud computing concepts allows scalable services to be provided to the client?

comments.content: Facts just see scalable you know

discussion.content: When you see the word "scalable" in a cloud environment question, it's a dead giveaway for "rapid elasticity".
Why is something that has to do with cloud on an A+ exam

comments.content: I would suggest others to review the objectives for Comptia A+ before taking the test. As virtualization and cloud computing is listed as 12% of the test within the official Comptia site.

discussion.content: This question by the way, is a perfect example of what I'm talking about, in that as far as I'm concerned CompTIA is deliberately trying to fail people so that they can charge them again for a retest, which is full price if you don't purchase one of their bundles. No desktop support technician would know this unless they were cloud certified, and so therefore this is an unfair question which does not belong on this test.

comments.content: I kind of agree with you. However, IT technicians need to know cloud services to recommend to a customer or a manager/boss.

discussion.content: As far as I'm concerned this question shouldn't even exist on this test, because it has nothing to do with desktop support. This question belongs on a cloud certification test, not A+.

Rapid elasticity is a cloud computing term for scalable provisioning, or the ability to provide scalable services. Experts point to this kind of scalable model as one of five fundamental aspects of cloud computing.
(from What is Rapid Elasticity? - Definition from Techopedia)
am not sure if it a correct answer but i will go with Rapid elasticity ?

Which of the following ports should the administrator open on the new firewall?

port 25 is standard SMTP

port 465 is SMTPS (SMTP Secure)
